intro: Fuirena brachylepis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. Fuirena brachylepis is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
